Class WaitStrategyUtil

java.lang.Object
driverutility.WaitStrategyUtil
public class WaitStrategyUtil extends Object
WaitStrategyUtil is a utility class that provides methods for waiting for certain conditions to be met in Selenium WebDriver. It supports both explicit waits and fluent waits.
Since:
2025-06-02
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ravi Shankar

  • Method Details

    • initWait

      public static WaitStrategyUtil initWait()
      Initializes a WebDriverWait instance with the default timeout specified in PropertyConfig.
      Returns:
      an instance of WaitStrategyUtil with WebDriverWait initialized.

    • initFluentWait

      public static WaitStrategyUtil initFluentWait(Long poll)
      Initializes a FluentWait instance with a specified polling interval.
      Parameters:
      poll - the polling interval in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      an instance of WaitStrategyUtil with FluentWait initialized.

    • ElementClickable

      public void ElementClickable(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element)
      Initializes a FluentWait instance with a specified polling interval and timeout.
      Parameters:
      poll - the polling interval in milliseconds.
      timeout - the timeout duration in seconds.

    • clickWhenPresent

      public void clickWhenPresent(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element)
      Clicks on a WebElement when it is present in the DOM.
      Parameters:
      element - the WebElement to be clicked.

    • clickWhenVisible

      public void clickWhenVisible(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element)
      Clicks on a WebElement when it is visible on the page.
      Parameters:
      element - the WebElement to be clicked.

    • acceptAlert

      public void acceptAlert()
      Waits for a WebElement to be present in the DOM.
      Parameters:
      element - the WebElement to wait for.

    • dismissAlert

      public void dismissAlert()
      Dismisses an alert if it is present.
      Parameters:
      element - the WebElement to wait for.

    • switchFrame

      public void switchFrame(Object frame)
      Switches the WebDriver context to a specified frame.
      Parameters:
      frame - the frame to switch to, can be an Integer (index), String (name or ID), or WebElement.
